values.authorQuote: In general I was a good kid. It usually took a lot to make me mad. But once I reached the boiling point, I lost all rational control. Totally without thinking, when my anger was aroused, I grabbed the nearest brick, rock, or stick to bash someone. It was as if I had no conscious will in the matter.
values.author: Ben Carson

values.authorQuote: The government is supposed to conform to our will. By taking the most important thing you have, your health and your health care, and turning that over to the government, you fundamentally shift the power, a huge chunk of it, from the people to the government. This is not the direction that we want the government to go in this nation.
values.author: Ben Carson

values.authorQuote: Intelligent people tend to talk about the facts. They don't sit around and call each other names. That's what you can find on a third grade playground.
values.author: Ben Carson

values.authorQuote: Our children need to see and hear about more black role models in many fields so they can make better choices.
values.author: Ben Carson

values.authorQuote: Kids have what I call a built-in hypocrisy antenna that comes up and blocks out what you're saying when you're being a hypocrite.
values.author: Ben Carson

values.authorQuote: God has opened many doors of opportunity throughout my lifetime, but I believe the greatest of those doors was allowing me to be born in the United States of America.
values.author: Ben Carson

values.authorQuote: People spending more of their own money on routine health care would make the system more competitive and transparent and restore the confidence between the patients and the doctors without government rationing.
values.author: Ben Carson

values.authorQuote: There is so much potential out there in young people and they aren't getting the right information or being encouraged in the right ways. This is our duty as a society.
values.author: Ben Carson

values.authorQuote: With everything that is complex, we learn. If you don't learn, then it's an utter and abject failure. If you do learn, and you're able to apply that to the next situation, then you take away a measure of success.
values.author: Ben Carson

values.authorQuote: Corporations are not in business to be social-welfare organizations; they are there to make money.
values.author: Ben Carson

values.authorQuote: Education is a fundamental principle of what made America a success. We can't afford to throw any young people away.
values.author: Ben Carson

values.authorQuote: Socialism states that you owe me something simply because I exist. Capitalism, by contrast, results in a sort of reality-forced altruism: I may not want to help you, I may dislike you, but if I don't give you a product or service you want, I will starve. Voluntary exchange is more moral than forced redistribution.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Distrust of government isn't baseless cynicism. It's realism.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Geopolitical drama lessened but did not die after the Cold War; in 2008, the specter of thousands of seeming automatons banging drums at the opening of the Beijing Games frightened and enthralled the world, reminding us that China was a nation on the rise, a competitor for global dominance.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Hillary Clinton is not that fascinating a person. According to those who have spent time with her, she's harsh and demanding. According to those who haven't - like her husband - she's a delight.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: If the United States had maintained its spending under Ronald Reagan, it is possible that the attacks of 9/11 - presaged by Islamic terror attacks on multiple American targets beginning with the first bombing of the World Trade Center in 1993 - would have been stopped.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Socialism violates at least three of the Ten Commandments: It turns government into God, it legalizes thievery and it elevates covetousness. Discussions of income inequality, after all, aren't about prosperity but about petty spite. Why should you care how much money I make, so long as you are happy?
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Historically, defense spending cuts have preceded increased international turmoil as America's global enemies sense a failure of will.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: During the Great Depression, levels of crime actually dropped. During the 1920s, when life was free and easy, so was crime. During the 1930s, when the entire American economy fell into a government-owned alligator moat, crime was nearly non-existent. During the 1950s and 1960s, when the economy was excellent, crime rose again.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Socialism has no moral justification whatsoever; poor people are not morally superior to rich people, nor are they owed anything by rich people simply because of their lack of success. Charity is not a socialist concept - it is a religious one, an acknowledgment of God's sovereignty over property, a sovereignty the Left utterly rejects.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Freedom of speech and thought matters, especially when it is speech and thought with which we disagree. The moment the majority decides to destroy people for engaging in thought it dislikes, thought crime becomes a reality.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Capitalism requires individual responsibility and accountability. People are seen as atomized units in a capitalist system - they are either useful, or they are not. They are not seen racially or ethnically or religiously. They consume and they produce, and those are their only relevant characteristics.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Why should Congresspeople have to visit D.C.? Thanks to Skype, meetings are possible across the country. Thanks to email, communications are simple. And we've had the technology to vote from afar for decades. Why should we have backroom deals made over cigars thousands of miles distant from those who are affected by those deals?
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: When Americans are faced with the prospect that they can never earn their way to wealth, they have two choices: to rebel against the system, or to settle into depressed complacency.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: 2013 was a year of myths falling apart. The myth of President Obama - a myth in which Obama was a messianic figure descending to bequeath health care, equality, and brotherhood on mankind - imploded. The myth of an America embracing the leftist social agenda collapsed.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: The Left masks its distaste for the Bible's condemnation of homosexuality in a straw man argument that Bible believers are violent bigots. They are not. Citing the Bible doesn't make you a bigot against human beings - it makes you a bigot against sin, which is a good thing.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: When people are desperate or wealthy, they turn to socialism; only when they have no other alternative do they embrace the free market. After all, lies about guaranteed security are far more seductive than lectures about personal responsibility.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: In order for Obamacare's cost structure to work, millions of Americans must sign up to pay inflated prices; that would help pay for the subsidies to cover insurance company costs on those with pre-existing conditions.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Kids are fat because of lack of parenting.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Every so often, we all gaze into the abyss. It's a depressing fact of life that eventually the clock expires; eventually the sand in the hourglass runs out. It's the leaving behind of everything that matters to us that hurts the most.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: The argument that gay marriage doesn't affect straight marriages is a ridiculous red herring: Gay marriage affects society and law in dramatic ways. Religious groups will come under direct assault as federal and state governments move to strip them of their non-profit statuses if they refuse to perform gay marriages.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Matt Damon's anti-fracking diatribe was funded by the royal family of the United Arab Emirates.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Selective Biblical quotation is a favorite of leftists who interpret the Bible the same way they do the Constitution: as a Chinese menu designed to allow picking and choosing. That's because when many Democrats take the Bible as a whole, they realize how much they despise it.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: The greatest bulwark against an overreaching government, as tyrants know, is a religious population. That is because religious people form communities of interest adverse to government control of their lives; religious communities rely on their families and each other rather than an overarching government utilizing force.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: President Obama's respect for the Constitution does not extend to freedom of religion - his administration has forced religious businessowners to pay for insurance plans that cover activities in violation of religious precepts.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: Same-sex marriage is not the final nail in the coffin for traditional marriage. It is just another road sign toward the substitution of government for God. Every moral discussion now pits the wisest moral arbiters among us - the Supreme Court, President Obama - against traditional religion.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: The ouster of Jill Abramson as executive editor of 'The New York Times' sent shock waves through the media landscape. Reports that she was fired thanks in part to a soured relationship based on the 'Times' alleged sexist pay discrepancy only made those shock waves stronger.
values.author: Ben Shapiro
values.authorOccupation: Political commentator, author, radio talk show host, lawyer

values.authorQuote: It's good to trust others but, not to do so is much better.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: Fascism is a religion. The twentieth century will be known in history as the century of Fascism.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: It is humiliating to remain with our hands folded while others write history. It matters little who wins. To make a people great it is necessary to send them to battle even if you have to kick them in the pants. That is what I shall do.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: The keystone of the Fascist doctrine is its conception of the State, of its essence, its functions, and its aims. For Fascism the State is absolute, individuals and groups relative.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: The best blood will at some time get into a fool or a mosquito.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: Let us have a dagger between our teeth, a bomb in our hands, and an infinite scorn in our hearts.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: Fascism, the more it considers and observes the future and the development of humanity, quite apart from political considerations of the moment, believes neither in the possibility nor the utility of perpetual peace.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: Democracy is beautiful in theory; in practice it is a fallacy.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: War is to man what maternity is to a woman. From a philosophical and doctrinal viewpoint, I do not believe in perpetual peace.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: The Liberal State is a mask behind which there is no face; it is a scaffolding behind which there is no building.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: Every anarchist is a baffled dictator.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: We become strong, I feel, when we have no friends upon whom to lean, or to look to for moral guidance.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: War alone brings up to their highest tension all human energies and imposes the stamp of nobility upon the peoples who have the courage to make it.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: All within the state, nothing outside the state, nothing against the state.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: Socialism is a fraud, a comedy, a phantom, a blackmail.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: The truth is that men are tired of liberty.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: Inactivity is death.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: It is the State which educates its citizens in civic virtue, gives them a consciousness of their mission and welds them into unity.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: The League is very well when sparrows shout, but no good at all when eagles fall out.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: The fate of nations is intimately bound up with their powers of reproduction. All nations and all empires first felt decadence gnawing at them when their birth rate fell off.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: The function of a citizen and a soldier are inseparable.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: The mass, whether it be a crowd or an army, is vile.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: Fascism is a religious concept.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: The history of saints is mainly the history of insane people.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: Fascism is not an article for export.
values.author: Benito Mussolini
values.authorOccupation: Leader of the National Fascist Party, Prime Minister of Italy

values.authorQuote: Courage is fire, and bullying is smoke.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

values.authorQuote: Like all great travellers, I have seen more than I remember, and remember more than I have seen.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

values.authorQuote: Seeing much, suffering much, and studying much, are the three pillars of learning.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

values.authorQuote: Never complain and never explain.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

values.authorQuote: Little things affect little minds.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

values.authorQuote: The view of Jerusalem is the history of the world; it is more, it is the history of earth and of heaven.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

values.authorQuote: I am prepared for the worst, but hope for the best.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

values.authorQuote: The secret of success is constancy to purpose.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

values.authorQuote: The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches but to reveal to him his own.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

values.authorQuote: Action may not always bring happiness; but there is no happiness without action.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

values.authorQuote: To be conscious that you are ignorant of the facts is a great step to knowledge.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

values.authorQuote: Fame and power are the objects of all men. Even their partial fruition is gained by very few; and that, too, at the expense of social pleasure, health, conscience, life.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

values.authorQuote: I have brought myself, by long meditation, to the conviction that a human being with a settled purpose must accomplish it, and that nothing can resist a will which will stake even existence upon its fulfillment.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

values.authorQuote: Nurture your minds with great thoughts. To believe in the heroic makes heroes.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

values.authorQuote: There are three kinds of lies: lies, damned lies, and statistics.
values.author: Benjamin Disraeli
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
